condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.1.2 Data collection, monitoring and analysisg and evaluation systems inform policy making and budgeting around issues related to youth and children, including child rights

description.narrative: UNICEF Kyrgyzstan data collection, research and analysis, covered a whole spectrum of the Country Programme programmatic areas and informed the new Country Programme for 2018-2022. Studies, assessments and evaluations have informed UNICEF's advocacy and policy decisions in the field of social protection, health, youth and education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: The availability and use by relevant decision makers of reliable disaggregated data on the situation of children and women

target.value: 2017:Disaggregated and comprehensive data on situation of children and women with particular focus on existing disparities are provided annually

actual.value: 2017:Disaggregated and comprehensive data on situation of children have been provided annually

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of Ombudsmans Office, National Human Rights Instititution, or a network of child rights civil society groups that are able to monitor and report on child rights violations

target.value: 2017:Regular/Annual Report with a section on monitoring and realisation of children's rights produced
